revised_title: Assessing the Environmental Impact of Chemical Substances: A Review of Biodegradability
tldr: This article discusses the significance of biodegradability in the treatment and discharge of waste waters to natural bodies of water. It describes various methods of assessing biodegradability and their limitations, examining factors that determine biodegradability, such as molecular structure. The article also reviews the principle of microbial infallibility and its implications for the degradation of synthetic and natural compounds.
